page.title: 16Housing - Change of Use
page.content:
One disused timber frame farmhouse has been preserved from ruin by being converted into a large barn for a neighbouring farm.
The R.C church in Broxwood was built in 1863 by the estate owners. The dark grey stone building with lancet windows is little used and currently is up for sale.
The former independant chapel in Broxwood, also in grey stone, and the adjoining school, have both been sold and converted into private residences
The "Old Workhouse" at Whitehill, a large red brick building dating from about 1836, is still used as Rural District offices but is also in the process of being converted by the local authority into residences.
